sentence.Network_en: Around midday, the fog lifted and puffy cumulus clouds appeared across the sky.
sentence.Network_cn: 中午前后雾散了，满天出现了蓬松的积云。

sentence.Network_en: From his bed he could see the great cumulus clouds that hung in the blue sky.
sentence.Network_cn: 躺在床上,可以望见碧蓝的天空中飘浮着大块团状的积云.

sentence.Network_en: A polar landscape of snowy hills, dramatic cumulus clouds and coastal glaciers.
sentence.Network_cn: 雪域丘陵 、 引人注目的积云和沿海冰川的极地景观.

entry.def: Cumulus is a type of thick white cloud formed when hot air rises very quickly.

means.word_mean: 2. a collection of objects laid on top of each other
